rules: Rule1: If the sensor network detects a chemical spill, then the automated alert system is triggered
Rule2: Provided that drone technology is available, then if the automated alert system is triggered, no festival event is ongoing
Rule3: Should ground teams be available, then if the automated alert system is triggered, no festival event is ongoing
Rule4: Either aerial surveillance was deployed, or drone technology is available, or ground teams are available
Rule5: If visitor evacuation is implemented, then temporary restrictions are not implemented
Rule6: Either the backup system is functioning, or if the data archive system is functioning, then conservation data is documented
Rule7: If water purification is initiated, then water purification is completed
Rule8: If water purification is completed, then water sources are not safe for wildlife
Rule9: If water samples are collected, then water sources are not contaminated with alcohol waste
Rule10: If water samples are analyzed, then water samples are collected
Rule11: If the contamination level is confirmed, then water samples are analyzed
Rule12: If conservation data is stored, then conservation data is documented
Rule13: If the sensor network reports illegal logging to park authorities, then the park authorities approve the conservation plan
Rule14: If the primary server is functional, then if it is not the case that if the data archive system is functioning then conservation data is stored, then manual backup is activated
Rule15: If the secondary server is functional, then if it is not the case that if the data archive system is functioning then conservation data is stored, then manual backup is activated
Rule16: If the sensor network is operational, then if the sensor network detects illegal logging, then the sensor network reports illegal logging to park authorities
Rule17: If water sources are contaminated with alcohol waste, then water purification is initiated
Rule18: If water sources are contaminated with alcohol waste, then water sources are safe for wildlife
Rule19: If the emergency protocol is activated, then if water sources are contaminated with alcohol waste, then water sources are not safe for wildlife
Rule20: If an environmental threat is confirmed, then the emergency protocol is activated
Rule21: Either a festival event is ongoing or park conditions are normal
Rule22: If neither the primary server is functional nor the secondary server is functional, then the emergency data protocol is activated

Rule23: If it is not the case that if it is not the case that if it is not the case that if it is not the case that if park conditions are not normal then emergency funding is authorized then visitor evacuation is implemented then the containment procedure is completed then ecosystem balance is restored then park operations are maintained

Rule24: If it is not the case that if it is not the case that if it is not the case that if it is not the case that if park conditions are not normal then emergency funding is authorized then visitor evacuation is implemented then the containment procedure is completed then ecosystem balance is restored then park operations are not maintained

Rule25: If it is not the case that if it is not the case that if park conditions are not normal then emergency funding is authorized then visitor evacuation is implemented then the containment procedure is not completed
Rule26: If it is not the case that if park conditions are not normal then emergency funding is authorized then temporary restrictions are implemented
Rule27: If park conditions are not normal, then the sensor network detects illegal logging
Rule28: If park conditions are not normal, then the data archive system is functioning
Rule29: If park conditions are not normal, then water sources are contaminated with alcohol waste
Rule30: If park conditions are not normal, then emergency funding is not authorized
facts: Fact1: The sensor network detects a chemical spill
Fact2: The contamination level is confirmed
Fact3: The sensor network is operational
Fact4: An environmental threat is confirmed
Fact5: The park authorities do not approve the conservation plan
Fact6: Aerial surveillance is not deployed
Fact7: Ecosystem balance is not restored
Fact8: Conservation data is not documented
Fact9: The backup system is not functioning
Fact10: Manual backup is not activated
Fact11: The emergency data protocol is not activated
